SSCI focuses on the creation of AI/ML enabled capabilities to command, control, communicate with, and manage composable collections of intelligent agents, smart sensors, and autonomous platforms across all domains. Duties  Help us build satellite mission-level autonomy flight software, test it, and deploy it to space Work as part of a team to design, implement, and test autonomy, AI, and machine learning algorithms and software systems for autonomous satellites Design software that implements autonomy, AI, and Machine Learning for real missions in space!  Requirements  Proficiency with C/C++  Experience with Machine Learning for vision systems and Computer Vision technologies such as CNNs, SLAM, Segmentation, Centroiding, etc.  Experience with Software-in-the-loop, PITL, and / or HITL flatsat testing  Background and expertise in implementation and integration of Satellite Flight Software  Experience performing advanced R&D of space systems Experience with systems and software engineering processes (software planning, design development tools, configuration management, test and QA methods)  Desired Skills  Experience with space and air systems CONOPS, spacecraft GNC/TT&C, payload integration and operations, satellite mission planning and ground systems, intelligence operations and science data collection, processing and exploitation  Proficiency with Linux ARM and CMake, and embedded system software development  Experience with Distributed Data Infrastructure  Fault Detection / FDIR (Fault detection, isolation, and recovery)  Familiarity with standard libraries used for AI, robotics, computer vision (e.g., ROS, MOOS)  Basic understanding of orbital dynamics, orbit regimes Familiarity with at least one space Modeling & Simulation framework (STK, GMAT, OreKit, FreeFlyer) Proficiency with networking and messaging systems (e.g. ZeroMQ, Google Protobuffer/Flatbuffer, middleware systems, ROS, TCP/UDP networking)  Benefits Salary is competitive with market rates, with annual bonus awards based on company and individual performance. SSCI benefits package includes 401K and Health/Life/Disability Insurance.

Are you looking to join a highly ambitious media analytics & software startup? Do you want to bring a groundbreaking product to market?  Cross Screen Media was founded by industry veterans and gives customers a new way to plan and execute video advertising campaigns by using a common currency for TV and digital. To achieve this, we need to build an amazing team. Here's where you come in…  We are looking to hire a Lead Data Scientist to support the ScreenSolve product strategy. The successful candidate will employ skills and experience to improve, create, and innovate using data and complex analytics to solve current business problems, while anticipating and charting future research needs. An integral component of the role is research and prototyping, incorporating foundational research and collaboration with ongoing initiatives within Cross Screen Media. There are computational elements as well, where candidates will have the opportunity to develop, design, prototype, and lead the implementations of new machine learning algorithms for large data sets.  Through thoughtful planning and purposeful analytics, we anticipate customer needs and enable our clients to connect with their audience in meaningful, targeted ways. We expect all data science team members to be hands-on with respect to the analysis of our data, using the full suite of Cross Screen Media's technical tools to create timely, relevant, and actionable insights.  Key Responsibilities  Lead and contribute to data analyses and modeling projects from project inception. Participate in business review meetings with internal and external stakeholders to determine requirements and deliverables, reception, and data processing. Lead analyses, prepare final reports and presentations, communicate results, and implement support. Leverage advanced statistical techniques to create high-performing predictive models and creative analyses to address business objectives. Research conference materials, books, journals, and publications to identify and implement cutting edge methodologies supported by current literature. Support the deployment of analytical solutions in production systems. Communicate with internal stakeholders concerning product design, data specification, and model implementation. Create project plans and timelines to ensure projects are completed on time with expected deliverables.  Experience  MS with 3-5 years of experience Degree in engineering, applied mathematics, statistics, or related quantitative fields. Strong understanding of numerical optimization methods. Extensive experience in machine learning / deep learning, reinforcement learning, representation learning, RNN, CNN, GNN, etc. Extensive experience in Python (and PySpark) as well as experience using modern machine learning / deep learning tools, such as scikit-learn, Tensorflow or Pytorch. Knowledge of distributed and cloud platforms, AWS preferred. What We Offer  This role offers a 100% remote work option Competitive salary with high bonus potential Collaborative and creative atmosphere, with inspired leadership Career advancement opportunities Recognition and reward for outstanding performance Great medical, dental & vision Insurance packages Competitive 401K with company match to plan for the long term Unlimited paid-time-off Transportation benefits & cell phone reimbursement Casual dress all day, every day   Unfortunately we are not able to sponsor visas for this position.

Peraton Overview   Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the worlds leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our employees do the cant be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.   Responsibilities  Provides intelligence support for contingency operations, battle staff and operational-level planning, Joint and multi-lateral training exercises, and strategic engagement policy throughout the Areas of Operational Responsibility (AOR) and Areas of Interest (AOI). Monitors and analyzes all strategic and operational aspects of political, military, and economic developments for the countries in the AORs and AOIs. Assesses future and on-going political-military developments, military capabilities and doctrine, weapons acquisitions, and employment of military forces within each country. Researches, authors, and coordinates threat assessments to support the Commander and the other senior leadership as well. Connects pieces of information that is available from different sources like field agents and form reliable reports on anti-terrorism and national security to deal with potential threats. Assesses the believability of the information from the reliable sources, collects it and validates intelligence. May provide team leadership to other Analysts. Provides a full range of intelligence and administrative support to assist analysts, engineers, and scientists involved in a variety of intelligence disciplines and activities. Activities include, but are not limited to, building and maintaining databases; execute intelligence master data management; data architecture; monitor intelligence; assists with administration and management of RFIs; produces metrics;provides crossdomain data transfer and intelligence dissemination support, system-high to -low transfers between JWICS, SIPRNet, NIPRNet, and other U.S. and Allied / Partner systems. Produces metrics, graphics, and briefings as required to support production management and mission management functions. Current DoD TS/SCI Security Clearance with ability to obtain CI polygraph  Qualifications   4 years demonstrated experience leading a team and managing work tasks of subordinates conducting intelligence planning, collection, processing, analysis, or dissemination. demonstrated experience involving complex security classification decisions such as coalition/foreign partner support, foreign disclosure, intelligence dissemination, or crossdomain operations. demonstrated ability to deliver professional briefings and presentations to diverse audiences. demonstrated ability to draft and maintain documentation such as Standard Operating Procedures and ability to produce reports incorporating text and graphics to convey complex concepts.  demonstrated understanding of metadata. demonstrated ability to instruct and interact with small groups on data and information requirements and coordination tasks. Demonstrates in-depth knowledge and understanding of the labor category activities required to meet mission requirements. Demonstrates mastery of qualitative and quantitative analytic methodologies and pursue developments in academia or other fields that affect tradecraft methodology. Demonstrates ability to define comprehensive, new, or unique research approaches that enable rigorous assessments to address and contribute to high-level tasks. Demonstrates in-depth analysis of analytic operations and knowledge management issues across organizational and intra-IC boundaries and clearly articulates key findings. Demonstrates ability to work independently and with minimal oversight. Demonstrates ability to review analytic products for cogent arguments, tradecraft standards, and adequate support for conclusions; routinely tests analytic rigor of analytic products. Desired Experience: Minimum 12 years of experience related to the specific labor category with at least a portion of the experience within the last 2 years. Required Experience: 10 years demonstrated experience in an intelligence discipline working in the DoD or IC within the last 2 years. Advanced Experience using Microsoft SharePoint 2013+

Why choose between doing meaningful work and having a fulfilling life? At MITRE, you can have both. That's because MITRE people are committed to tackling our nation's toughest challenges—and we're committed to the long-term well-being of our employees. MITRE is different from most technology companies. We are a not-for-profit corporation chartered to work for the public interest, with no commercial conflicts to influence what we do. The R&D centers we operate for the government create lasting impact in fields as diverse as cybersecurity, healthcare, aviation, defense, and enterprise transformation. We're making a difference every day—working for a safer, healthier, and more secure nation and world. Our workplace reflects our values. We offer competitive benefits, exceptional professional development opportunities, and a culture of innovation that embraces diversity, inclusion, flexibility, collaboration, and career growth. If this sounds like the choice you want to make, then choose MITRE—and make a difference with us. As an experienced  Principal  Data Scientist , you might be wondering what makes MITRE different than other government contractors and consulting firms. Many of our recent hires answered YES to at least one of the questions below: Are you interested in contributing to or leading technical projects that you can feel passionate about? Are you tired of having your performance tied to billable hours? Do you want to feel like your ideas are valued and you are more than just an FTE? Are you interested in working for a company where a 40-hour week is the norm and not the exception? Do you want exceptional benefits, including tuition reimbursement for coursework towards an advance degree in a technical discipline? The Model-Based Analytics Department is seeking a motivated, creative Principal Data Scientist  for MITRE’s Mclean, VA location  to apply cutting edge tools and techniques to challenging problems facing the US government. This position offers the opportunity to interact directly with government leaders in a fast-paced and dynamic atmosphere with the ability to make a difference and impact outcomes with solid analysis. As one of four departments in MITRE’s Modeling, Simulation, Experimentation & Analytics Innovation Center, the Model-Based Analytics Department provides expertise in Complex Systems Modeling and Analysis, Computational Social Science, Data Analytics, and Rapid Prototyping to various MITRE programs supporting government customers. MITRE is applying Data Science and Analytics to some of our nation’s greatest challenges, including creating dashboards and analyses supporting the MITRE-led COVID-19 Healthcare Coalition . Our employees are expected to work on multiple projects, cross-pollinate good ideas across the government and continuously learn. We are truly an interdisciplinary department that thrives on having a large toolbox to support data- and model-driven decision making. We value people who can bring diverse perspectives. Our department works to solve problems in the public interest, in partnership with the government. We also actively conduct independent research in areas of interest to our government partners. To be successful you will: Be passionate about applying data analytics to real world problems, with a willingness to adapt and learn. Initiate and lead projects and tasks throughout their life cycle, including conceptualization, requirements definition, data procurement, development, integration, and socialization. Proactively architect analytic solutions and recommendations to meet sponsor objectives as a strategic data science thought- and action- partner – for example, identifying new/novel uses of large data holdings using data science methods to close mission gaps. Provide relevant day-to-day tasking for one or more junior staff and ensure staff members follow approved practices for modeling, simulation, and data analytics. Utilize critical thinking, strong judgement, and both an autonomous and a collaborative work ethic with sponsors and colleagues. Experience facilitating discussions with executive audiences is a must. Work with a spectrum of government sponsors to gain understanding of their challenges, evaluate possible solutions, and conduct insightful, actionable analyses. Present results in an intuitive, actionable manner that can be understood by all sponsor audiences, regardless of technical expertise. Required Qualifications Bachelors’ degree in Operations Research, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or other related technical field of study. 10+ years of work experience or equivalent combination of education, qualifications, and experience. Must be a US citizen capable of obtaining and maintaining a US government clearance. Experience designing data science tasking and leading a team of distributed data scientists. Demonstrated experience leading customer facing engagements emphasizing data analytics. Ability to apply, modify, and formulate algorithms and processes to solve challenging problems. Past track record of innovation and implementing emerging technology and capabilities. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated ability to manipulate large datasets and perform calculations with at least one modern programming language like Python, SAS, R, Matlab, C++, or Java. Experience visualizing multi-dimensional data using tools like Tableau, ggplot2, Plotly, matplotlib, seaborn, or D3.js. Significant academic background in a quantitative field such as Operations Research, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Statistics. Preferred Qualifications Advanced degree in Operations Research, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or other related technical field of study. Prior proven experience with designing and architecting analytic systems from design to production (e.g., Minimum Viable Product [MVP]). Proven history of coaching, motivating, and leading teams to optimal performance levels by establishing clear goals, reviews, and consistent feedback. Experience leading or conducting research. Experience applying various machine learning approaches (e.g., random forest, neural networks, support vector machines) to complex problems. Prior experience working with databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, Oracle, MySQL, MongoDB, Neo4j). Experience using version control (e.g., Git, Mercurial, SVN) to support collaborative development. Experience utilizing analytic notebooks (e.g., Jupyter, Zeppelin). Prior experience developing interactive data visualizations using open source web technologies (Angular, Vue, React, D3.js) or other frameworks (Shiny, Plotly Dash). Prior experience developing data-intensive full stack containerized web applications using Node.js, Flask, Django, or other technologies. Familiarity with working in cloud-based environments like Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud, or Microsoft Azure and their machine learning tools. Experience working with big data analytic environments including Apache Spark, Presto, Impala, or other distributed SQL engines. Active TS/SCI with poly. Prior experience working with the Department of Defense (DoD) and/or Intelligence Community (IC). This requisition requires the candidate to have a minimum of the following clearance(s): None This requisition requires the hired candidate to have or obtain, within one year from the date of hire, the following clearance(s): Secret MITRE requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated prior to their employment start date. MITRE will provide reasonable accommodation to those with a medical condition, disability or a sincerely held religious belief that prevents them from receiving a vaccine so long as it does not create an undue hardship for MITRE and/or does not pose a direct threat to the health or safety of the employee or others in the workplace. About the Team  STR’s Analytics division researches and develops advanced analytics and machine learning-based solutions to solve challenging problems related to national security. Our projects span multiple different data modalities and incorporate advanced algorithms, deep learning, and statistical techniques to uncover patterns in social media, structured and unstructured text, time series, geospatial, and imagery data. The tools and technologies we develop have real world impact and are used by analysts to extract and enrich intelligence information around the globe.  The Role  As a  Machine Learning Engineer – Data Science , you will develop, implement, and evaluate statistical machine learning algorithms to uncover hidden information and patterns from a diverse collection of massive datasets. You will apply state of the art and novel techniques such as supervised and unsupervised learning, machine learning, and deep learning to problems such as classification, anomaly detection, and forecasting. You will develop cutting edge systems and work collaboratively with our software engineers to design and deploy models into production. You will interact with customers to understand requirements and apply iterative feedback to development. This position is based in office and applicants should expect to primarily work onsite. Requirements Who You Are  Experience with multiple regression and classification techniques such as Support Vector Machines, Random Forests, Naïve Bayes Classifiers, and Deep Neural Networks  Experience in data grooming and handling large, messy or incomplete datasets  Degree in some examples include a scientific field such as Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Data Science, or Physics  Understanding of and experience with statistical and machine learning techniques  Proficiency with a one or more programming language such as Python, MATLAB, Java, or C++  Previous experience (internships and academic work included) working with complex datasets and building statistical, machine learning, or deep learning models  Motivated collaborator who’s comfortable communicating to both technical and non-technical audiences  Currently holds a top secret security clearance or better  Even Better  MS or PhD in a scientific field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Physics  Track record of developing, implementing, and evaluating statistical algorithms against real datasets  Specialized expertise in a data-rich field such as time-series analysis, graph analytics, geospatial analysis, image processing, or Bayesian programming  Experience with one or more deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or Tensorflow  Experience working with large datasets and familiarity with big data infrastructure, such as AWS, Hadoop, Spark, Dask, or MapReduce  Active TS or TS/SCI security clearance  STR is a rapidly growing technology company with locations north of Boston, MA, Arlington, VA and near Dayton, OH. We specialize in advanced research and development for defense, intelligence, and national security, trying to understand how to protect our society: from stopping malicious botnet attacks, to understanding cyber vulnerabilities, providing next generation sensors, radar, sonar, communications, and electronic warfare to developing artificial intelligence algorithms and analytics to make sense of the complexity that is exploding around us. STR is committed to creating a collaborative learning environment that supports deep technical understanding and recognizes the contributions and achievements of all team members. Our work is challenging, but you go home at night knowing that you pushed the forefront of technology and made the world a little safer. We recognize that the world is changing, that it is becoming more connected than ever before, making things change faster than before, and reshaping society in the process. We all want to understand this changing world and leave it better for our work. STR is not just any company. Our people, culture, and attitude along with their unique set of skills, experiences, and perspectives put us on a trajectory to change the world. We can't do it alone, though - we need fellow trailblazers. If you are one, join our team and help to keep our society safe! Visit us at www.str.us for more info. STR is an equal opportunity employer. We are fully dedicated to hiring the most qualified candidate regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation and pregnancy), marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any portion of the employment process, email us at appassist@str.us and provide your contact info. Pursuant to applicable federal law and regulations, positions at STR require employees to obtain national security clearances and satisfy the requirements for compliance with export control and other applicable laws

The data architects need to be futurists who are able to translate business requirements into technology requirements and define data standards and methodologies along the way.  Serve as a subject matter expert to guide and integrate diverse stakeholder information into a holistic data approach for relevant E2E processes  Analyze and validate whether data models and other solution components meet the intent of the client’s strategy  Review anything from client policies, to system data fields, to understand how the relevant data model will impact to day-to-day operations  Develop various courses of action for the client to help mitigate risks and increase analytical visibilities  Work within interdisciplinary teams to ensure organizational information exchange requirements are identified and met  Contribute to the establishment of data management strategies, principles, models, and standards  Assess the integration of proposed standards to ensure successful implementations across interdependent technologies  Work with governance teams to identify data governance and applicable standards  Consult with project teams ensuring alignment with enterprise data architecture standards  Conduct research, develop position-papers, reports and presentations for briefings to application teams   Basic Qualifications :  Top Secret/Sensitive Compartmentalized Information (TS/SCI) required  Experience with Power BI, Tableau, and other data visualization tools  Hands on knowledge with data management, data architecture and data modeling within the DoD and/or Federal space  Experience in SQL, Python, data modeling, Artificial Intelligence and machine learning preferred  In depth experience with Conceptual/Logical/Physical data modeling experience  Experience with leading and architecting system analysis, software changes and integrations across multiple technologies  Experience with complex problem-solving strategies. Able to determine the source of a problem and find effective solution(s) through an in-depth evaluation of varying factors. Strong capacity for abstract reasoning and creative visioning.  Demonstrated experience in leading cross-functional teams; experience with working complex projects remotely is a plus  Strong interpersonal, verbal, presentation and writing skills to successfully interact with colleagues and executive client leadership  BS Degree in applicable field required  Graduate Degree in applicable field (or near completion) preferred  Benefits:  Alta Via Consulting provides a competitive salary and a full range of benefits including, but not limited to:  Unlimited PTO  Medical Insurance  Vision Insurance  Dental Insurance  ST/LT/ADD and Life Insurance  Continuing Education & Training  401(k) plan that includes employer contributions  Alta Via Consulting is an Equal Opportunity Employer and VEVRAA Federal Contractor.
